events.message: The customer reported their car was involved in a collision with another vehicle at a red light intersection, causing significant damage.
The claim has been categorized under the 'Auto Accident' cluster based on the description of the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent specialized in auto accidents was assigned to handle the claim and contact the customer.
The claim was officially acknowledged, and the customer was informed that the investigation would commence shortly.
Requested the customer to submit the police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed.
The customer provided all requested documents, including the police report and multiple photos showing the vehicle damage.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacting witnesses to verify the details of the accident.
Investigation concluded confirming the accident circumstances and damage assessments aligning with the customer’s report.
A settlement offer was proposed based on damage valuations and policy coverage limits, sent to the customer for review.
The customer acknowledged receipt of the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the offer terms.
The claim was approved per the settlement agreement, and preparations for payment issuance began immediately.
Payment was issued to the customer’s bank account to cover vehicle repairs and related expenses as agreed in the settlement.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that the customer received the payment and the repair process was underway.
